entry.title: G7 urges Armenia, Azerbaijan to return to negotiating table

media:group.media:title: G7 urges Armenia, Azerbaijan to return to negotiating table
media:group.media:description:
üìçThe Group of Seven advanced countries, plus the European Union, called on Armenia and Azerbaijan to return to the negotiating table and reach a peace deal. üìçThe United States‚Äô banking watchdog ordered New York‚Äôs Citibank to pay nearly $26 million in fines after finding it illegally discriminated against Armenian Americans. üìçArmenia and Italy agreed to begin cooperating on certain unspecified security matters.

media:group.media:title: Solving educational challenges through gamification
media:group.media:description:
Professor Mark Nowacki played chess professionally when he was a student. Now, he is helping students of all ages learn at schools, universities, and elsewhere while playing and enjoying the game. His company, LogicMills, is situated in Singapore, but his involvement with students is global. This episode is about the game, the students, the teachers, and how gamification could solve many challenges the education systems face.

entry.title: Azerbaijan‚Äôs dictator shows no signs of stopping

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan‚Äôs dictator shows no signs of stopping
media:group.media:description:
This week on Insights, host Eric Hacopian breaks down Armenia's latest economic data that shows signs of strong growth. He also gives details about the new Armenian-French defense agreement and its strategic implications.Tune in for analysis and explanation on important developments.

entry.title: US, Russia reaffirm commitment to Armenia-Azerbaijan peace talks

media:group.media:title: US, Russia reaffirm commitment to Armenia-Azerbaijan peace talks
media:group.media:description:
üìçA military court in Azerbaijan sentenced Vagif Khachatryan, an Armenian man from Nagorno-Karabakh, to 15 years in prison on charges of genocide and forcible population transfer. Khachatryan has repeatedly denied the charges. üìçArmenia has purchased $41.5 million worth of anti-drone systems from India, according to that country‚Äôs Eurasian Times newspaper. CivilNet has not been able to independently verify the news. üìçThe United States and Russia each reaffirmed their commitment to facilitating talks to allow Armenia and Azerbaijan to reach a peace deal.
Credits: Ruptly

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs top general holds talks with US military

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs top general holds talks with US military
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmen Grigoryan, Armenia‚Äôs security chief, declined to attend an upcoming meeting with his counterparts from other former Soviet countries in Russia. üìçArmenia‚Äôs top army officials held talks on defense cooperation with senior officials at the United States‚Äô military headquarters in Europe. üìçLevon Kocharyan, the son of ex-President Robert Kocharyan, was released from detention after agreeing to take up a seat in Armenia‚Äôs parliament. üìçArmenia submitted a bid to host the 2027 Francophone games.
